trans-unit.source: <token>sb1</token> supports a set of REST APIs for runtime and management (AtomPub) operations.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb1</token> supports a set of REST APIs for runtime and management (AtomPub) operations.

trans-unit.source: Using REST, you can write applications in any language that supports HTTP requests, without the need for a client SDK.
trans-unit.target: Using REST, you can write applications in any language that supports HTTP requests, without the need for a client SDK.

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> is a multi-protocol service: you can send and receive messages to or from the service using REST or .NET managed API, mixing and matching clients using different protocols in a given scenario.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> is a multi-protocol service: you can send and receive messages to or from the service using REST or .NET managed API, mixing and matching clients using different protocols in a given scenario.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can send a message to a queue using one protocol and consume it using a different protocol.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can send a message to a queue using one protocol and consume it using a different protocol.
